filmography.title: A Thousand Clowns
filmography.role_description: The successful, conventional brother and agent of the eccentric protagonist, who tries to persuade him to conform to societal norms for the sake of his nephew.
filmography.plot: A free-spirited comedy writer is forced to find a job and conform to society to keep custody of his young nephew.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: 12 Angry Men
filmography.role_description: The jury foreman, a calm and methodical high school football coach who tries to keep the contentious deliberations orderly.
filmography.plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence in a murder trial.
filmography.awards: AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#87), 100 Thrills (#88), 10 Top 10 (#2 Courtroom Drama)

filmography.title: Psycho
filmography.role_description: A private investigator hired to track down a missing woman and the stolen money, leading him to a fatal encounter at the Bates Motel.
filmography.plot: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

filmography.title: Breakfast at Tiffany's
filmography.role_description: A Hollywood agent who discovered Holly Golightly and serves as a father figure, despite being frustrated by her flighty nature.
filmography.plot: A young New York socialite becomes interested in a young man who has moved into her apartment building, but her past threatens to get in the way.

filmography.title: All the President's Men
filmography.role_description: The Managing Editor of The Washington Post who supports Woodward and Bernstein's investigation into the Watergate scandal.
filmography.plot: The Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Nixon's resignation.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#77), 100 Thrills (#57)

filmography.title: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
filmography.role_description: A disgruntled former subway motorman who serves as the co-conspirator and operator of the hijacked train, known by his code name 'Mr. Green'.
filmography.plot: In New York, armed men hijack a subway car and demand a ransom for the passengers. Even if it's paid, how could they get away?

filmography.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
filmography.role_description: The Commander-in-Chief of the U.S. Pacific Fleet who is caught unprepared by the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the series of American blunders that allowed it to happen.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: Cape Fear
filmography.role_description: The sympathetic police chief who tries to help his friend Sam Bowden protect his family from a vengeful ex-convict but is limited by the law.
filmography.plot: A lawyer and his family are stalked by a man he once helped put in jail.

filmography.title: Catch-22
filmography.role_description: An ambitious, bureaucratic officer who keeps raising the number of combat missions required for his men to return home.
filmography.plot: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

filmography.title: Little Big Man
filmography.role_description: A snake-oil salesman and con artist who loses body parts progressively throughout the film but maintains his cheerful cynicism.
filmography.plot: Jack Crabb, looking back from extreme old age, tells of his life being raised by Native Americans and fighting with General Custer.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor (Chief Dan George)

filmography.title: Seven Days in May
filmography.role_description: The President's loyal White House aide who is sent on a dangerous mission to Gibraltar to obtain crucial evidence of a military coup.
filmography.plot: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor (Edmond O'Brien)

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: The director of the train line and a friend of Hercule Poirot who assists him in investigating the murder but is constantly baffled.
filmography.plot: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Ingrid Bergman)

filmography.title: The Bedford Incident
filmography.role_description: The newly assigned ship's doctor on a U.S. destroyer who serves as a civilian counterpoint to the Captain's obsessive pursuit of a Soviet submarine.
filmography.plot: An American destroyer captain is determined to confront a Soviet submarine caught violating territorial waters, escalating the Cold War tension.

filmography.title: Hombre
filmography.role_description: A Mexican stagecoach driver who is one of the few characters to show kindness and understanding to the protagonist.
filmography.plot: John Russell, disdained by his "respectable" fellow stagecoach passengers because he was raised by Indians, becomes their only hope for survival when they are set upon by outlaws.

filmography.title: The Anderson Tapes
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant antique dealer who acts as the fence for a planned heist of an upscale apartment building.
filmography.plot: A thief just released from prison recruits a team to rob a luxury apartment building, unaware that they are under electronic surveillance.

filmography.title: Summer Wishes, Winter Dreams
filmography.role_description: The kind, understanding optometrist husband of a woman going through a midlife crisis, whom she has taken for granted.
filmography.plot: A New York housewife re-examines her life and relationships after her mother's death, leading to a journey of self-discovery.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Carpetbaggers
filmography.role_description: A movie studio boss based on real-life moguls, who clashes with the Howard Hughes-esque protagonist.
filmography.plot: A playboy inherits an industrial empire and expands into aviation and movie making while ruthlessly alienating everyone around him.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Martin Balsam)

filmography.title: The Stone Killer
filmography.role_description: A powerful Mafia don who plots a massive revenge scheme using Vietnam veterans as hitmen.
filmography.plot: A tough detective uncovers a plot by a Mafia boss to use Vietnam veterans to wipe out his rivals in a gang war.

filmography.title: Two-Minute Warning
filmography.role_description: The stadium manager who must deal with the crisis of a sniper loose in the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum during a championship football game.
filmography.plot: A sniper sets up position at a major football game, and police and SWAT teams try to take him out before he starts shooting.

filmography.title: Time Limit
filmography.role_description: The efficient, somewhat cynical aide to the Colonel investigating a Korean War treason case.
filmography.plot: An investigator tries to determine why a highly decorated officer collaborated with the enemy while in a Korean POW camp.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Al Capone
filmography.role_description: A cynical newspaper reporter who chronicles Capone's rise and eventually becomes entangled in his corruption.
filmography.plot: A biopic of the notorious Chicago gangster Al Capone, following his rise from a bouncer to the biggest crime boss in the city.

filmography.title: After the Fox
filmography.role_description: The dyspeptic agent of a fading movie star who gets dragged into a criminal mastermind's plot to smuggle gold.
filmography.plot: A criminal mastermind escapes from prison and poses as a film director to smuggle stolen gold into Italy under the guise of filming a movie.

filmography.title: Confessions of a Police Captain
filmography.role_description: An idealistic police commissioner who tries to take down a corrupt system and realizes the law is insufficient to stop the Mafia.
filmography.plot: A police commissioner and a DA try to prove that a prominent architect is actually a Mafia boss, but they face corruption at every turn.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Foreign-Language Film

filmography.title: The Sentinel
filmography.role_description: A professor who translates a mysterious Latin text that reveals the terrifying truth about a Brooklyn brownstone.
filmography.plot: A young model moves into a historic apartment building, only to discover it houses a gateway to Hell.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: Marjorie Morningstar
filmography.role_description: A kind, stable doctor who represents the traditional, reliable life that the protagonist ultimately chooses over a bohemian existence.
filmography.plot: A young Jewish woman in 1950s New York pursues an acting career and falls for a charismatic but unreliable playwright.
